page.title: 03POTTERIC CARR NATURE RESERVE
page.content: It was during the 1960s that mining subsidence altered the ecology of the area making it an area of reedfen and marsh attractive to wildlife. Since 1968 the{Yorkshire Naturalists Trust} have had agreement with British Rail to tenant Low Ellers Marsh. Despite threats from the building of the M18 and railway reorganisation in the 1970s and 1980s they have managed to extend the reserve and secure the future of its{wildlife.} The Reserve can be reached from the A638 or the A630. There are car parks at grid reference: SE598010 and SE590007. There is a hide at Low Ellers and the Bessacarr nature walk open to the public. Balby Carr nature trail is open to Trust members but other parts of the reserve require a British Rail walking permit.
